member.name: T:Waher.Content.IContentConverter
member.summary: Basic interface for Internet Content encoders. A class implementing this interface and having a default constructor, will be able to partake in object encodings through the static class. No registration is required.

member.name: P:Waher.Content.IContentConverter.FromContentTypes
member.summary: Converts content from these content types.

member.name: P:Waher.Content.IContentConverter.ToContentTypes
member.summary: Converts content to these content types.

member.name: P:Waher.Content.IContentConverter.ConversionGrade
member.summary: How well the content is converted.

member.name: M:Waher.Content.IContentConverter.Convert(System.String,System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.IO.Stream,Waher.Script.Variables,System.String[])
member.summary: Performs the actual conversion.
member.param: Content type of the content to convert from.
Stream pointing to binary representation of content.
If the content is coming from a file, this parameter contains the name of that file. Otherwise, the parameter is the empty string.
Local resource name of file, if accessed from a web server.
URL of resource, if accessed from a web server.
Content type of the content to convert to. This value might be changed, in case the converter finds a better option.
Stream pointing to where binary representation of content is to be sent.
Possible content types the converter is allowed to convert to. Can be null if there are no alternatives.
member.returns: If the result is dynamic (true), or only depends on the source (false).

member.name: M:Waher.Content.InternetContent.GetContentType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the content type of an item, given its file extension. It uses the to see if any of the content encoders/decoders support content with the corresponding file type. If no such encoder/decoder is found, the generic application/octet-stream type is returned.

member.summary: Tries to get the content type of an item, given its file extension.

member.name: P:Waher.Content.InternetContent.Converters
member.summary: Available Internet Content Converters.

member.name: M:Waher.Content.InternetContent.CanConvert(System.String,System.String,Waher.Content.IContentConverter@)
member.summary:
Checks if it is possible to convert content from one type to another.
A shortest path algorithm maximizing conversion quality and shortening conversion distance is used to find sequences of converters, if a direct conversion is not possible.
member.param: Converter that transforms content from type to type .

member.name: M:Waher.Content.InternetContent.GetConverters(System.String)
member.summary: Gets available converters that can convert content from a given type.
member.param: From which content type converters have to convert.
member.returns: Available converters, or null if there are none.

member.name: M:Waher.Content.Text.CsvCodec.Decode(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Text.Encoding,System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.String}[],System.Uri)
member.summary: Decodes an object.
member.param: Any encoding specified. Can be null if no encoding specified.
Any content-type related fields and their corresponding values.
Base URI, if any. If not available, value is null.
member.exception: If the object cannot be decoded.

member.name: M:Waher.Content.Text.CsvCodec.TryGetContentType(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to get the content type of an item, given its file extension.

member.name: M:Waher.Content.Text.CsvCodec.Encodes(System.Object,Waher.Runtime.Inventory.Grade@,System.String[])
member.summary: If the encoder encodes a given object.
member.param: How well the encoder encodes the object.
Optional array of accepted content types. If array is empty, all content types are accepted.
member.returns: If the encoder can encode the given object.

member.name: M:Waher.Content.Text.CsvCodec.Encode(System.Object,System.Text.Encoding,System.String@,System.String[])
member.summary: Encodes an object.
member.param: Desired encoding of text. Can be null if no desired encoding is speified.
Content Type of encoding. Includes information about any text encodings used.
Optional array of accepted content types. If array is empty, all content types are accepted.
member.exception: If the object cannot be encoded.
